item.description:
Jambo:

So basically you’re a pussy?

Nah. I’ve seen movies ranging from Passion of the Christ (:facepalm , the Watchmen (:|), the Evil Dead “trilogy” ( ), Dead Alive ( ), Blair Witch Project (:pffft , and thousands of other movies.

Again, District 9 is the only movie that was the only movie that actually made me ill.

Or maybe it was the movie theater food.

Jack:

I kinda hated it. I never did understand why someone would carry the burden of carrying a camera (The letter C, COMBO BREAKER)

New York was getting attacked by a giant monster, why WOULDN’T you record that?

Pffft, I’d be out recording it with my iphone while taking popshots at it with my m4.

I liked it, now I feel like watching it! >.<.

item.source: District 9 Movie Trailer - Half Life Inspired?

item.title: District 9 Movie Trailer - Half Life Inspired?
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Excellent movie and I will almost certainly buy the DVD. I don’t see why there’s so much dislike for the shaky cam. This movie’s camera was nowhere near as bad as the Blair Witch Project or Cloverfield and it amazes me how many people get motionsick from movies.

The CGI was amazing for such a small budget and the action was awesome. The thing I found strange was that the aliens (especially Christopher) were way more likable than the humans. When they had Christopher on the ground and were about to shoot him I was on the edge of my seat screaming “No, don’t do it!” . If they make a sequel there’s no question that I’ll go see it.

Read full topic

item.title: District 9 Movie Trailer - Half Life Inspired?
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
danielsangeo:

Nothing ever is.

Back on topic, am I the only one that didn’t particularly care for District 9? I found it one of the most vomit-inducing movies that I’ve ever seen. If it isn’t the ShakyCam, it’s the absolute “Squick” factor.

Normally, when I leave a movie, I feel either or or :[ or even :facepalm:…but that was the first time I felt :sick:

So basically you’re a pussy?

item.title: District 9 Movie Trailer - Half Life Inspired?
item.dc:creator: The_Assassin47
item.description:
Ram, we know what it does and how that functions, but we dont know why.
We dont know why things are pulled in. Sure general relativity, but why does it do that?

One theory is gravitrons, particles that would cause it. Gravity isnt fully explained.

item.description:
Also the exoskeleton had a gravity gun like thing, but that concept isn’t new either. Star wars did it before Half-Life 2 and probably some other books/movies too which I don’t know about.

That has been mankinds dream for a long time to be able to cheat gravity. It’s one of the forces that hasn’t been completely explained yet either.

item.source: District 9 Movie Trailer - Half Life Inspired?

item.title: District 9 Movie Trailer - Half Life Inspired?
item.dc:creator: saivert
item.description:
yeah, the aliens were similar to Vortigonts in HL2 they also had arms coming out of the stomach region.

Then again I’m not saying the movie is inspired by Half-Life as that is most likely not true. It’s is more correct to say that all sci-fi draws inspiration from each other and you find certain concepts in every sci-fi movie. This is just limitation of human imagination. It’s hard to come up with something brand new that doesn’t look or feel similar to something else. The only way to truly get something original is to find alien lifeforms for real, but we have not done that yet so we can’t know for certain what it looks like.

District 9 was a bit slow moving, and I kinda hated the protagonist for being such a pussy and weak person. He could have stood up for himself a bit more. He had a management role after all. I would certainly never have hired him like that.

Effects were nice, and the exoskeleton/mech thing was how it was. Sure they could have made it seem more real, but what is real? Is that making the machinery look more like what humans would have created? this was alien tech after all. You could say the same about the alien weaponry.

bad spelling I know.

Read full topic
item.source: District 9 Movie Trailer - Half Life Inspired?

item.title: District 9 Movie Trailer - Half Life Inspired?
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
When it comes to biology, I really think there’s more Dr. Who reference than Half-Life reference.

Then again, you could say the same drew inspiration from illithids. But Oodkind were cut off and enslaved in a similar fashion, so there may be more of a relationship than one would think.

Read full topic
